text:
Lucy Ozarin (8 August 1914 – 17 September 2017) was an American psychiatrist. She was born in Brooklyn, New York. She served in the United States Navy. She was one of the first women psychiatrists commissioned in the Navy, and she was one of seven women Navy psychiatrists who served during World War II.
During her late nineties, Ozarin wrote over fifty brief biographies of psychiatrists on Wikipedia.
Ozarin died in Bethesda, Maryland on 17 September 2017 of respiratory failure at the age of 103.
